title: Elandsdoorn Road (Tambo)Contract in Limpopo Elias Motsoaledi?
text:
Moutse Business Forum , has observed with shock how the local businesses within Moutse has yet once again been deprived of being able to tender on an equal footing for work in the area, and as such being able to be awarded the contract, as they all have the necessary skills, experience and qualification, and would then be able to alleviate poverty, create employment and also contribute positively to the local economy.
The Elias Motsoaledi Local Council in its methodology and following all of the procurement requirements invited companies to tender for work and construction on the Elandsdoorn Road, and after doing all of the due diligence on those companies that tendered, finally awarded the contract and the work to a specific company in the amount of R 5.5 million.
All work having been successfully completed and Council then deciding to extend on the project, yet this time around, didn’t advertise the work and invited companies to tender, and under the ‘top up facility’ decided to award the extension of the work to the same contractor that did the first phase, yet the ‘top-up’ amounted to more than R 7.5 million which in essence represents a top-up of 136.36% which may not exceed 20% in terms of policy.
This kind of ‘top-up’ done is highly irregular, and is a gross contravention of methodology that is allowed and may be done, but the fact that local businesses were excluded from competing on an equal basis for the work, is highly irregular and discriminatory.
One need to look closely at the relationship that may exists between the contractor that so handsomely benefitted from this unorthodox procedure applied and those within Council that considered it appropriate to act in this macabre and most unusually way.
That this is prejudice in its best is unequivocally so.
An investigation into the action and methodology adopted should be done as a matter of urgency to eradicate possible ‘brotherly ex gratia’ payments that may have been the order of the day in the manner and status quo of the contract and monies paid out.
